decks.notes: The key idea behind this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy using low-cost creatures and disruptive spells. It focuses on maintaining card advantage and protecting its creatures through a combination of evasion, protection spells, and counterspells. The deck aims to establish early board control with creatures like Siren Stormtamer and Merfolk Trickster while delivering quick damage with evasive creatures like Pteramander and Tempest Djinn. The inclusion of Curious Obsession adds card draw and increased pressure. Overall, the deck aims to apply consistent pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and card advantage. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's plans by using cards like Thought Erasure, Kaya's Wrath, Cast Down, and Vraska's Contempt to remove threats from the board. It also has card draw and selection options with Chemister's Insight and Search for Azcanta. The deck contains a mix of planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Karn, Scion of Urza to generate additional value and control the game. The deck's mana base consists of a mix of dual and shock lands, ensuring consistent mana for powerful spells.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively deal damage to the opponent's life total using a combination of spells and creatures. It focuses on efficiently drawing and discarding cards to fuel the graveyard and trigger powerful effects from cards like Arclight Phoenix and Crackling Drake. It also includes spells like Shock and Lava Coil to control the board and remove threats. The deck utilizes the UR color combination to take advantage of powerful spells like Beacon Bolt, Entrancing Melody, and Ral, Izzet Viceroy. The mana base consists of a mixture of mountains and islands to support the color requirements of the spells and creatures.

The focus of this deck is to aggressively attack the opponent using low-cost and evasive creatures such as Merfolk Trickster, Pteramander, and Tempest Djinn. It aims to protect these creatures with countermagic like Spell Pierce and Wizard's Retort, as well as with protective spells like Dive Down and Siren Stormtamer. The card advantage is generated through Curious Obsession and Chart a Course, allowing for consistent threats and pressure. The deck's main color is blue, utilizing primarily Islands to support its mana base.

The deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with small but powerful white creatures, backed up by cards that enhance their abilities and provide protection. The strategy is to quickly build a board presence and apply pressure on the opponent early in the game. The deck aims to swarm the battlefield with creatures like Skymarcher Aspirant and Snubhorn Sentry, supported by cards like Venerated Loxodon and Benalish Marshal to boost their power. The inclusion of removal spells like Baffling End and Conclave Tribunal helps maintain board control while aggressive cards like Legion's Landing provide additional value.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly swarm the opponent with low-cost creatures while protecting them with disruptive spells like Dive Down and Spell Pierce. The goal is to maintain card advantage through effects like Curious Obsession while overwhelming the opponent with efficient creatures like Pteramander and Tempest Djinn. The deck relies on tempo and aggression to control the pace of the game and win through a combination of evasive attacks and countermagic.

The main focus of this deck is to play low cost aggressive creatures and burn spells to deal damage quickly and efficiently to the opponent. The deck utilizes cards like Fanatical Firebrand, Ghitu Lavarunner, and Viashino Pyromancer to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. It also includes burn spells such as Shock, Lightning Strike, and Wizard's Lightning to finish off the opponent or remove blockers. Experimental Frenzy allows the deck to continue drawing and playing cards even when mana is limited. The mana base consists of primarily Mountains along with Stomping Ground and Rootbound Crag for mana fixing.

The main goal of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly with cards like Growth Spiral and Wilderness Reclamation in order to cast Nexus of Fate multiple times in a single turn. By continually taking extra turns, the player can draw more cards, gain life, and ultimately overwhelm the opponent through sheer card advantage and board control. Cards like Search for Azcanta help filter through the deck for key pieces while Root Snare provides protection from aggressive decks. Overall, the deck aims to create a looping combo engine that allows for a powerful win condition.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy using low-cost, evasive creatures like Merfolk Trickster, Mist-Cloaked Herald, and Pteramander. Supporting spells like Dive Down, Spell Pierce, and Wizard's Retort help protect your creatures while also disrupting your opponent's game plan. Curious Obsession provides card advantage, while Tempest Djinn serves as a powerful finisher. The deck aims to maintain tempo and pressure the opponent consistently to secure a victory.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by using a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and card advantage engines. With cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Search for Azcanta, you can generate card advantage and control the board. By using cards like Kaya's Wrath and Vraska's Contempt, you can efficiently deal with your opponent's threats. The deck aims to outvalue your opponent through card advantage and removal spells, ultimately allowing you to grind out a win in the late game.

The focus of this deck is to quickly generate mana through Wilderness Reclamation and Search for Azcanta, while controlling the game with counterspells like Sinister Sabotage and removal such as Blink of an Eye. By chaining together extra turns with Nexus of Fate, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with card advantage and large creatures like Hydroid Krasis. The goal is to efficiently dig through the deck, stall opponents, and eventually establish an unbreakable loop of extra turns to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to generate value through exploring and gaining life with cards like Wildgrowth Walker and Jadelight Ranger, while also controlling the board with removal spells like Cast Down and Vraska's Contempt. The deck also aims to ramp up mana quickly with Llanowar Elves and Incubation Druid in order to play powerful threats like Hydroid Krasis and Carnage Tyrant. Vivien Reid provides additional card advantage and removal, while Hostage Taker can steal opposing threats. The deck combines aggro elements with a midrange strategy to apply pressure and outvalue opponents.

The main concept of this deck is to control the board state and disrupt your opponent's game plan through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and card advantage. The deck aims to establish a dominant board presence with Teferi, Hero of Dominaria while using cards like Thought Erasure and Vraska's Contempt to deal with threats. The deck also includes card draw and search effects to ensure you have the right answers at the right time. Overall, the goal is to outlast and outmaneuver your opponent until you can secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game using powerful planeswalkers like Teferi and Kaya, supported by a variety of removal spells and counterspells to disrupt opponents. The deck aims to survive the early game with board wipes like Kaya's Wrath and Cry of the Carnarium, while generating card advantage through spells like Chemister's Insight and Search for Azcanta. The mana base is carefully crafted to ensure consistency in casting spells and maintaining a solid control over the game flow.

The deck focuses on controlling the board and disrupting the opponent's strategy through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and hand disruption. Teferi, Hero of Dominaria provides card advantage and tempo advantage, while Lyra Dawnbringer serves as a win condition and stabilizes the board against aggressive decks. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by efficiently dealing with threats and maintaining card advantage through Search for Azcanta. The mana base is optimized to support the triple-color requirements of the deck, ensuring consistent access to all necessary colors of mana.

The focus of this deck is to quickly deploy aggressive creatures like Goblin Chainwhirler, Gruul Spellbreaker, and Rekindling Phoenix to apply pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes removal spells like Lightning Strike and Lava Coil to deal with threats from the opponent. The mana base is optimized for casting the spells on curve and ensuring a consistent stream of threats. The overall strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, powerful creatures and burn spells to secure a victory.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly play powerful flying creatures such as Crackling Drake, Enigma Drake, and Pteramander. You aim to control the board with cheap removal spells like Lava Coil and Shock while protecting your creatures with cards like Dive Down and Spell Pierce. Chart a Course and Discovery / Dispersal help with card advantage and maintaining tempo. This deck is focused on applying pressure early and maintaining a strong board presence to overwhelm your opponent before they can stabilize.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, focusing on quickly dealing damage and controlling the board. The deck utilizes a combination of cheap creatures with impactful abilities such as Hero of Precinct One, Judith, the Scourge Diva, and Fireblade Artist, along with powerful removal spells like Mortify and Cast Down. The inclusion of Angrath, the Flame-Chained provides additional value and disruption to the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to maintain pressure throughout the game and close out matches swiftly.

The core idea behind this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of Merfolk creatures. The deck focuses on generating token creatures with cards like Deeproot Waters and Benthic Biomancer, and then pumping those tokens up with cards like Deeproot Elite and Merfolk Mistbinder. This creates a powerful and efficient board presence that can quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes some disruptive elements with Merfolk Trickster to disrupt the opponent's plans and control the board. Overall, the deck aims to establish a dominant position on the battlefield and quickly finish off the opponent.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with evasive creatures like Mist-Cloaked Herald and Pteramander, supported by counterspells like Wizard's Retort and Spell Pierce to protect them. The goal is to consistently deal damage to the opponent while drawing cards with Curious Obsession and maintaining control of the game through tempo plays with cards like Merfolk Trickster. The Mono Blue Aggro archetype aims to overwhelm the opponent early in the game and secure a victory before the opponent can stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly establish a board presence with low-cost creatures such as Merfolk Trickster and Mist-Cloaked Herald, while protecting them with counter spells like Spell Pierce and Wizard's Retort. The goal is to maintain card advantage with Curious Obsession and push damage through with evasive creatures like Pteramander and Tempest Djinn. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast-paced aggressive strategy, utilizing the mono blue color scheme to effectively control the tempo of the game.

The main focus of this Mono Blue Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent quickly with low-cost creatures and disruptive spells. By playing evasive creatures like Mist-Cloaked Herald and Pteramander, along with protection spells like Dive Down and Siren Stormtamer, the deck aims to maintain board control while drawing additional cards with Curious Obsession. With counterspells like Wizard's Retort and disruption from Merfolk Trickster, the deck can maintain tempo and pressure the opponent to win the game swiftly.

The main focus of this deck is to maintain a strong control over the board while continuously pressuring the opponent with aggressive creatures. By utilizing cheap, evasive threats like Pteramander and Mist-Cloaked Herald alongside disruptive spells like Spell Pierce and Wizard's Retort, the deck aims to quickly chip away at the opponent's life total. Additionally, the inclusion of card draw spells like Chart a Course and Curious Obsession helps to ensure a steady stream of threats while protecting them with cards like Dive Down and Siren Stormtamer.

The deck focuses on utilizing Wilderness Reclamation to generate extra mana and cast multiple spells per turn. The goal is to loop extra turns with Nexus of Fate while controlling the board with removal spells like Blink of an Eye and Sinister Sabotage. Search for Azcanta helps to dig through the deck for key pieces, while Hydroid Krasis provides a big threat and card advantage. The deck aims to out-value the opponent by chaining extra turns and overwhelming them with powerful spells and card advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to use Wilderness Reclamation in combination with various card draw and search spells to consistently cast Nexus of Fate and take extra turns. By generating a large amount of mana and continuously taking extra turns, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and close out the game quickly. The inclusion of Hydroid Krasis provides a win condition while also gaining card advantage. The deck focuses on creating a repetitive loop of extra turns and card advantage to outpace and outplay the opponent.

This Sultai Aggro deck focuses on ramping up mana with Llanowar Elves and Incubation Druid to play powerful creatures like Wildgrowth Walker, Jadelight Ranger, and Hydroid Krasis quickly. Vivien Reid offers additional card advantage and removal. Hostage Taker and Carnage Tyrant provide versatility and resilience against control decks. Find / Finality is used for graveyard recursion and board wipes, while removal spells like Cast Down and Vraska's Contempt handle threats. The deck's mana base is carefully constructed to enable consistent mana production for its multi-colored cards.

The deck focuses on utilizing a combination of efficient creatures and disruptive spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By playing powerful threats like Thief of Sanity and Hydroid Krasis, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Hostage Taker and Thought Erasure, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and win the game before the opponent can stabilize. The inclusion of powerful planeswalkers like Vraska, Relic Seeker and Vivien Reid adds additional versatility and strength to the overall strategy.

The main idea of this deck is to apply constant pressure on the opponent by quickly casting powerful creatures and disruption spells. By utilizing a combination of creatures like Hydroid Krasis, Jadelight Ranger, and Hostage Taker, along with removal spells like Assassin's Trophy and Vraska's Contempt, the deck aims to control the board while dealing damage to the opponent. The inclusion of planeswalkers like Vraska, Relic Seeker and Vivien Reid provides additional versatility and card advantage, making it harder for the opponent to keep up with the relentless aggression of the Sultai Aggro archetype.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively control the board with creatures like Hydroid Krasis, Jadelight Ranger, and Hostage Taker, while also gaining life and card advantage with Wildgrowth Walker and Vivien Reid. The deck aims to have a strong mana base with Llanowar Elves and efficient removal spells like Cast Down and Vraska's Contempt. Additionally, the deck utilizes graveyard recursion with Find / Finality and has a flexible game plan with both aggressive and controlling elements in place.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game through countering opponent's spells, removing threats with burn spells, and drawing cards to maintain card advantage. The deck aims to ramp up mana with Wilderness Reclamation and efficiently use it with Expansion / Explosion to either finish off opponents or draw cards. The inclusion of Niv-Mizzet, Parun as a win condition helps to close out games quickly. Search for Azcanta provides additional card selection and filtering to ensure the deck runs smoothly.

This deck focuses on utilizing low-cost, aggressive white creature cards to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of creatures and generate strong board presence. By using cards like Tithe Taker, Snubhorn Sentry, and Venerated Loxodon, along with support from cards like Dauntless Bodyguard and Conclave Tribunal, this deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain tempo advantage throughout the game. The inclusion of cards like History of Benalia and Unbreakable Formation further bolsters the deck's ability to go wide and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on building a wide board presence of low-cost creatures quickly to overwhelm the opponent. Cards like Benalish Marshal and Venerated Loxodon provide buffs to all creatures, while cards like Dauntless Bodyguard and Adanto Vanguard offer protection. History of Benalia and Legion's Landing help generate additional tokens, while removal spells like Baffling End and Conclave Tribunal deal with opposing threats. The mana base is built to support the aggro strategy with a mix of white dual lands.

The main focus of this Esper Control deck is to effectively control the board and opponent's resources through a combination of removal spells, counters, and powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria. With cards like Thought Erasure to disrupt the opponent's hand and sweepers like Kaya's Wrath, the deck aims to maintain control of the game until it can establish a dominant position. The inclusion of card advantage engines like Search for Azcanta and the utility of Kaya, Orzhov Usurper also provide additional ways to outvalue the opponent and grind out a win.

Utilizing a combination of strong creatures and disruptive spells, this Sultai Aggro deck focuses on applying early pressure with efficient creatures like Llanowar Elves and Wildgrowth Walker. The deck includes powerful explore creatures like Jadelight Ranger to gain card advantage and life while also allowing for explosive plays with Hydroid Krasis. Thief of Sanity and Hostage Taker provide additional disruption by stealing opponent's cards. The deck also includes removal spells like Vraska's Contempt and Assassin's Trophy to handle threats, making it a versatile and formidable aggro deck in the Standard format.

The focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent quickly with a swarm of low-cost white creatures. By playing multiple creatures per turn and leveraging anthems like Benalish Marshal and Venerated Loxodon, the deck aims to build a wide board presence and apply constant pressure. Cards like Adanto Vanguard and Legion's Landing provide additional utility and resilience, while History of Benalia helps to create a powerful late-game finisher. The deck also includes removal options like Conclave Tribunal to deal with potential threats from the opponent, creating a versatile and aggressive strategy.
